definition: to see a visitor out
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
customer/visitor/guest

sentences.english: I constantly found myself tongue-tied when it came to seeing guests off at the door.
sentences.chinese: 作爲美國人，每當要我送客出門時，我總是舌頭打結。

sentences.english: Will all non passenger leave the train right away?
They ride through the streets pulling passengers and goods.
sentences.chinese: 車伕們穿梭在大街小巷來送客和送貨。

sentences.english: As an American，I constantly found myself tongue-tied when it came to seeing guests off at the door.
sentences.chinese: 作爲美國人，每當要我送客出門時，我總是舌頭打結。

definition: to ask sb to leave/to show sb the door/to give a tenant notice to leave
the First Emperor's order to expel foreigners/(fig.) notice to leave/words or behavior intended at turning visitors out
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to meet a person
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to wave (one's hand)
to take one's seat
to act tactfully/tactful/discreet
to do as one pleases/to not inconvenience oneself
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
tactful/discreet
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
